title: She’s running Boston so children like her daughter get access to healthcare
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Jordan Whitaker is running the 2026 Boston Marathon to support Mass. Eye and Ear.
Whitaker's daughter received crucial medical treatment at Mass. Eye and Ear for severe sinus cysts.
The 25-year-old from Deering, NH, aims to help other children access critical healthcare.

title: A.J. Brown’s Eagles teammate doesn’t buy Patriots trade possibility
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: A.J. Brown has been linked to the Patriots as a potential trade target amid receiving changes.
Eagles teammate Saquon Barkley dismisses rumors, stating Brown's wink about joining Patriots was trolling.
ESPN's Adam Schefter reports potential trade talks, despite Brown's past frustrations and trade requests.

title: Here’s what Boston meteorologists are saying about the timing and impacts of the Sunday-Monday nor’easter
author: John Waller
bullets: Meteorologists expect heavy snow, strong winds, and coastal flooding in southeast Massachusetts and Rhode Island late Sunday through Monday.
Power outages are of high concern due to heavy, wet snow and strong winds, with metro Boston possibly receiving up to 15 inches.
A potential bomb cyclone could bring blizzard conditions, especially impacting Cape Cod and the Islands, enhancing the storm's severity.

title: Alex Bregman declines to respond to Sam Kennedy’s comments about player’s Red Sox departure
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Bregman declined to comment on Sam Kennedy's remarks about his departure from the Boston Red Sox.
Red Sox President Sam Kennedy suggested Bregman could have stayed if he wanted, sparking online discussions.
Bregman signed with the Chicago Cubs, citing more reasons than just receiving a no-trade clause in their offer.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Apocalypse Now' (Redux) featuring Robert Duvall is streaming on Pluto TV and Plex.
'Blue Moon,' starring Ethan Hawke as Lorenz Hart, is available on Netflix.
'The Last Thing He Told Me' Season 2, starring Jennifer Garner, is streaming on Apple TV.

title: Red Sox INF Marcelo Mayer has to earn spot on Opening Day roster, Alex Cora says
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Marcelo Mayer must improve his offense to secure a spot on the Red Sox Opening Day roster, says manager Alex Cora.
Mayer, 23, batted .228 with four home runs in 136 plate appearances last season but struggled with injuries.
Mayer primarily practiced at second base as full squad training began, with continued competition for infield positions.

title: 7 maps predicting snowfall totals Sunday-Monday
author: John Waller
bullets: A major winter storm is expected to bring 10 to 20 inches of snow to eastern Massachusetts and Rhode Island.
Blizzard conditions and power outages are possible Sunday night through Monday due to heavy snow and strong winds.
Meteorologists anticipate heightened grocery shopping and travel disruptions, especially as school vacation week ends.

title: Lindsay Clancy appears in court for first in-person hearing since allegedly killing her children
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Lindsay Clancy appeared in person for her court hearing for the first time since allegedly killing her children in 2023.
Clancy, 35, faces murder and strangulation charges for the deaths of her three children in Duxbury on Jan. 24, 2023.
Her attorney plans to pursue an insanity defense, arguing Clancy was medicated and experiencing a psychotic break.

title: Cape Cod adopts transfer fee on home sales over $1 million
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Barnstable County Assembly approved a real estate transfer fee on home sales over $1 million, moving it to the state legislature.
The fee could raise $60 million annually for housing, with rates from 0.5% to 4% on amounts above $1 million.
90% of fee revenue would go to towns for housing efforts; 10% would support a regional housing trust overseen by Select Board appointees.

title: Peabody police warn about ‘Northshore Mall takeover’
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Peabody police are on alert for a planned 'Northshore Mall takeover' event scheduled at 3 p.m. on Friday.
Local law enforcement is coordinating to ensure public safety amid expected large crowds at Northshore Mall in Peabody.
State legislation proposes allowing police to confiscate vehicles involved in these meetups to enhance public safety.
